unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Interest in UP**
normalised: energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies spark interest in U P

unnormalised: Lucknow – Good news for homeowners in Uttar Pradesh looking to go solar! The UP government is offering some sweet subsidies on rooftop solar panel installations, and folks are lining up.
normalised: lucknow – good news for homeowners in Uttar Pradesh looking to go solar! the U P government is offering some sweet subsidies on rooftop solar panel installations, and folks are lining up.

unnormalised: Sources say the subsidy, up to Rs. 30,000 for systems covering up to 3 kW, is proving to be a game-changer. Imagine cutting down your reliance on those pesky electricity bills from UPPCL and generating your own bijli!
normalised: sources say the subsidy, up to rupee thirty thousand for systems covering up to three kilowatt, is proving to be a game-changer. imagine cutting down your reliance on those pesky electricity bills from U P P C L and generating your own bijli!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a resident of Gomti Nagar, says he's already applied for the subsidy to cover his 1000 sq ft rooftop. "My neighbour, Mrs. Verma, already installed panels last year, and her bill is practically zero! Hoping for the same magic, bhai!" he chuckled.
normalised: doctor Sharma, a resident of Gomti Nagar, says he's already applied for the subsidy to cover his one thousand square feet rooftop. "my neighbour, missus Verma, already installed panels last year, and her bill is practically zero! hoping for the same magic, bhai!" he chuckled.

unnormalised: MNRE is also pushing these schemes nationally, but UP's aggressive implementation has truly caught the eye. Industry analysts predict a surge in solar installations across the state, potentially adding hundreds of MW to the grid. So, get those applications in, before the subsidy runs out! Don't be the last Sharmaji to jump on the solar bandwagon.
normalised: M N R E is also pushing these schemes nationally, but U P's aggressive implementation has truly caught the eye. industry analysts predict a surge in solar installations across the state, potentially adding hundreds of megawatt to the grid. so, get those applications in, before the subsidy runs out! don't be the last Sharmaji to jump on the solar bandwagon.
